item.title: Byron Scherf is a con artist, says former prison inmate
item.description: A man who served time with the inmate accused of killing a Monroe corrections officer says Byron Scherf would minister to other people, conduct sermons and counsel inmates.

item.title: Female passenger dies in crash, driver saved by Good Samaritan
item.description: Police say a single car crash killed a woman and injured a man early this morning. It happened in Auburn around one o'clock. The crash also knocked out power to 7300 customers. The power has since been restored.

item.title: Arlington dog musher shares perspective on sled-dog mass killing
item.description: 100 sled dogs were massacred in Whistler, B.C. Dominic Gaudin of Arlington, a sled dog racer himself, calls it a bean counter mentality.

item.title: Video game argument led to Bellevue teen shooting brother, say police
item.description: Bellevue police say a 16-year-old shot his 12-year-old brother in the mouth. The older brother allegedly said he bought the gun for protection and didn't mean to shoot his sibling.

item.title: Midwest buckles under storm
item.description: A colossal blizzard roaring across a third of the country paralyzed the nation's heartland with ice and snow, leaving motorists stranded for hours and shuttering airports and schools as it barreled toward the Northeast.

item.title: Popular First Hill grocery store closes doors
item.description: After four years in business, M Street Grocery has closed its doors for good. Owner Matt Randish said he was not able to reach a lease agreement with his landlord.

item.title: 2 Portland-area sisters missing on Gorge hike
item.description: A search was underway Wednesday morning in frigid conditions for two sisters in their 50s who were hiking the Horsetail Falls trail.

item.title: African cat caught in Longview neighborhood
item.description: Some residents in a Longview neighborhood thought a cheetah was on the loose when they saw a large spotted cat showing up on backyard decks.

item.title: Did murdered corrections officer make security camera request?
item.description: Two sides are battling over whether Monroe prison corrections officer Jayme Biendl made a request to have cameras put in the prison chapel. Biendl was strangled there over the weekend.

item.title: Colossal storm roars through nation's heartland; Sea-Tac flights affected
item.description: Chicago expects 2 feet of snow, Indianapolis an inch of ice, and the Northeast still more ice and snow in what's shaping up to be a record winter for the region.
